page.title: 06SUPERSTITIONS-LT.GADDESDEN
page.content: Jarman lived in the Manor House in the 18th century.He was said to have been crossed in love and then killed himself.The ghost of Jarman was said to ride a blue headless horse down to Bluepit Pond with two white horses which he watered on the green.Jarman plays tricks with the lights (and is still said to do so) on one particular day of the year. Rosina Jane Massey,father of General Massey, a writer,lived in Witchcraft in the 1850's.Rosina was reputed of always being drunk and to have strange powers.On one occasion she went out collecting wood chips.When rebuked by other woodcutters she cast a spell on them so their axes stayed in the trees, and collected all their wood chips.She did many other strange things and died in 1866.
